thread.title: Motorists warned after 'car rapist' caught on camera having sex with SKODA
thread.title_full: Motorists warned after 'car rapist' caught on camera having sex with SKODA

author: Mirror .co.uk
title: Motorists warned after 'car rapist' caught on camera having sex with SKODA
text:
News Motorists warned after 'car rapist' caught on camera having sex with SKODA An aggrieved car owner said: "This pervert also 'raped' my neighbour's Mazda but my Octavia turns him on more." Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Man filmed on CCTV 'having his way with a SKODA' Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Motorists in the Czech Republic are being warned to be on the lookout for a man who has sex with CARS. 
The petrolhead has been caught on camera a number of times apparently getting intimate with parked vehicles. 
The latest CCTV footage captures the man approach a blue Skoda in an enclosed car park in the city of Pilsen and reportedly inset himself into the petrol cap. 
After apparently satisfying himself, he then saunters away as if nothing out of the ordinary has happened. 
Local media have branded the man a "car rapist." The petrolhead was caught on camera apparently having sex with a Skoda (Photo: CEN) 
And reports claim it's not the first time he has targeted parked cars. Read More 
He has been seen in the city's district of Skvrnany and in the garage of the Otylie Beniskova's building, where the CCTV video comes from. 
The owner of the blue Skoda Octavia in the video said he felt aggrieved about the incident. Locals claim it's not the first time the 'car rapist' has targeted vehicles (Photo: CEN) 
He told local media: "This pervert also 'raped' my neighbour's Mazda but my Octavia turns him on more. 
"He goes there like it’s a brothel!" Read More 
The car’s owner also asked local media to publish the video to warn local car owners and hopefully to avoid further similar incidents. 
Attraction to inanimate objects is known as objectophilia. 
A 2009 study by clinical sexologist Amy Marsh found about half of people with objectophilia had some kind of autism spectrum disorder, though the study’s sample size was small at just 21 respondents. Like us on Facebook
